text: Cross-Reference For details on the different levels of formality required on large and small projects, see Chapter 27. Design is a huge topic, so only a few aspects of it are considered in this chapter. A large part of good class or routine design is determined by the system architecture, so be sure that the architecture prerequisite discussed in Architecture Prerequisite has been satisfied. Even more design work is done at the level of individual classes and routines, described in Chapter 6, and Chapter 7.
